title: Software and Tools I Use
description: A detailed look into the technology stack I use daily.

body.raw: I've been building (complexier) software over 6 years and have experimented with a variety of tools and technologies. Here's a detailed look into the software and tools I use daily: ### Always with me - Macbook Pro M1 Max 16" (2020) - iPhone 13 ### Productivity - **Note-taking**: I use Notion for organizing my thoughts, tasks, and projects. - **Task Management**: I rely on Superlist for managing my daily tasks and projects. - **Calendar**: I use Fantastical for managing my calendar and scheduling events. - **Focus**: I use Opal for blocking distracting websites and apps during work hours. ### Development Tools - **Code Editor**: I use Visual Studio Code for all types of development tasks. It's fast, extensible, and has a vibrant ecosystem of extensions. - **Terminal**: It may sound old-school, but I prefer the macOS default Terminal for most of my command-line tasks. ### Frontend Development - **Framework**: I work with Next.js for all types of projects. Absolutely my go-to choice! - **Styling**: I use TailwindCSS for rapid prototyping and styling components. - **Component Library**: I use ui.shadcn for building accessible and responsive UI components. ### Backend Development - **Server**: I work with Node.js for server-side development. - **Database**: I use primarily MongoDB for NoSQL databases and PostgreSQL for relational databases. - **Deployment**: I deploy applications on Vercel, Azure, and AWS ### Design and Prototyping - **Design Tools**: I work with [Figma](https://www.figma.com) for UI/UX design and prototyping. - **Management**: I use Linear for managing design tasks and projects. --- ### Programming Languages - **C/C++**: I have experience with C/C++ for low-level programming tasks. - **JavaScript**: I work with JavaScript for frontend and backend development. - **TypeScript**: I use TypeScript for type-safe JavaScript development. - **Python**: I use Python for scripting and data analysis tasks. - **Rust**: I'm learning Rust for systems programming and performance-critical tasks. - **SQL**: I work with SQL for database management and querying. --- ### Conclusion This is a high-level overview of the software and tools I use daily. I'm always open to trying new tools and technologies to improve my workflow. If you have any suggestions or recommendations, feel free to reach out to me on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/gabfon_).
